xxl.cursors
Class Remover

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.cursors.DecoratorCursor
        |
        +--xxl.cursors.Remover
Direct Known Subclasses:
WhileRemover
public class Remover
extends DecoratorCursor

The Remover is a DecoratorCursor that removes all elements of the input-Iterator, that means remove is called for all elements of the input-Iterator.

Note: The input-Iterator is wrapped to a Cursor.

Each call to the input-Cursor's method next implies that cursor.remove is called.
So the element returned by next is automatically removed from the underlying collection.
The caller is not able to traverse the underlying collection again by using the reset method.

See Also:
Iterator, DecoratorCursor

Method Detail

next

public Object next()
            throws NoSuchElementException,
                   UnsupportedOperationException
Returns the next element in the iteration.
This element will be removed from the underlying collection, if next is called. So the caller is not able to traverse it again by using the reset method.
Overrides:
next in class DecoratorCursor
Returns:
the next element in the iteration.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - iteration has no more elements.
